greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Remove prime factors of form 4*k+3.
comment: a(n) <= n; a(a(n)) = a(n); for all factors p^m of a(n): p=2 or p=4*k+1.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p) = (if p==3 (mod 4) then 1 else p).
mathematica: a[n_] := n/Product[{p, e} = pe; If[Mod[p, 4] == 3, p^e, 1], {pe, FactorInteger[n]}];
program: return 1 if n == 1 else reduce(mul, [1 if i%4==3 else i**f[i] for i in f])# _Indranil Ghosh_, May 08 2017
(PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, if ((f[k,1] % 4) == 3, f[k,1]=1)); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 08 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 17 2002
